gamecore.entity

Class EntityBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • gamecore.entity.EntityBuilder

  • public final class EntityBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    The EntityBuilder class is the only legal way to instantiate a new Entity object. This class implements the Builder pattern as described in Effective Java.
    Author:
    Alex Chythlook

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EntityBuilder(java.lang.String name, EntityType type)
      Each Entity starts with a String name and an EntityType type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Entity build()
      Crates a new Entity instance, using the parameters previously passed to the EntityBuilder object.
      EntityBuilder experience(int experience)
      Each Entity has an experience amount corresponding to its relative power.
      EntityBuilder setInventory(gamecore.Inventory inventory)
      Be default, each new Entity will be provided with an empty Inventory appropriate to their stats.
      EntityBuilder setSalt(int salt)
      The Salt is used to make each individual Entity unique.
      EntityBuilder setStatMap(java.util.Map<Attribute,java.lang.Integer> statMap)
      By default, stats will be determined at random.
      EntityBuilder setWeapon(Weapon weapon)
      By default, a new Entity will be equipped with a basic, 1-power Dexterity weapon.
      EntityBuilder statsNotRandom()
      stats are usually determined at random upon Entity creation.
      EntityBuilder statsToBuff(Attribute... attributesToBuff)
      If one or more stats should be slightly higher then the others when they are generated, invoke this method and pass them through.
      EntityBuilder statsToNerf(Attribute... attributesToNerf)
      If one or more stats should be slightly lower then the others when they are generated, invoke this method and pass them through.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityBuilder

        public EntityBuilder(java.lang.String name,
                     EntityType type)
        Each Entity starts with a String name and an EntityType type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Entity to be built.
        type - The EntityType of the Entity to be built. Used for categorical purposes.

    • Method Detail

      • setStatMap

        public EntityBuilder setStatMap(java.util.Map<Attribute,java.lang.Integer> statMap)
        By default, stats will be determined at random. If specific stats are desired, however, this method can be invoked.
        Parameters:
        statMap - Must include one of each Attribute Enum object as a key.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • statsToBuff

        public EntityBuilder statsToBuff(Attribute... attributesToBuff)
        If one or more stats should be slightly higher then the others when they are generated, invoke this method and pass them through. The inverse of the statsToNerf function.
        Parameters:
        attributesToBuff - One or more Attribute enum objects. Each Attribute passed in will be slightly stronger then it normally would be, upon stat generation.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • statsToNerf

        public EntityBuilder statsToNerf(Attribute... attributesToNerf)
        If one or more stats should be slightly lower then the others when they are generated, invoke this method and pass them through. The inverse of the statsToBuff function.
        Parameters:
        attributesToNerf - One or more Attribute enum objects. Each Attribute passed in will be slightly weaker then it normally would be, upon stat generation.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • setSalt

        public EntityBuilder setSalt(int salt)
        The Salt is used to make each individual Entity unique. By default these are generated randomly. If a spcific salt is desired, this method can be invoked.
        Parameters:
        salt - An int used to determine the unique identity of the new Entity.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • experience

        public EntityBuilder experience(int experience)
        Each Entity has an experience amount corresponding to its relative power. This value is used to determine its level. By default, an Entity starts with 100 experience (level 1 as of this version).
        It is recommended that this value be changed to something equivalent to the area that the Entity will be appearing in.
        Parameters:
        experience - A numerical representation of the new Entity's power. See the Reference class for more information about the formula used to determine levels.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • statsNotRandom

        public EntityBuilder statsNotRandom()
        stats are usually determined at random upon Entity creation. If this behavior is not desired, this method can be invoked. This sets the stat builder to provide the base stat amounts for each stat, modified by the stats set to be buffed and nerfed.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • setInventory

        public EntityBuilder setInventory(gamecore.Inventory inventory)
        Be default, each new Entity will be provided with an empty Inventory appropriate to their stats. This method can be called if the Entity is to have a specific inventory.
        Parameters:
        inventory - an instance of Inventory to be added to the new Entity, rather then the default stat-appropriate one provided at build.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • setWeapon

        public EntityBuilder setWeapon(Weapon weapon)
        By default, a new Entity will be equipped with a basic, 1-power Dexterity weapon. This method can be invoked if a more appropriate weapon is to be held at build.
        Parameters:
        weapon - The weapon for the new Entity to be holding.
        Returns:
        The EntityBuilder instance, so that the method can be chained.

      • build

        public Entity build()
        Crates a new Entity instance, using the parameters previously passed to the EntityBuilder object.
        Returns:
        A new instance of Entity.
